items.label: Chapter 4: Project - Simple Humanoid Joint Control
Chapter 2: Building a Unity Digital Twin
Chapter 3: Sensor Simulation in Gazebo & Unity
Chapter 3: Nav2 Path Planning for Humanoids

intro.title: Introduction
intro.description: This book introduces you to the core concepts of modern robotics and AI systems.

module-1/chapter-1-core-concepts.title: Chapter 1: Core ROS 2 Concepts
module-1/chapter-1-core-concepts.description: This chapter covers the fundamental concepts of the Robot Operating System (ROS) 2, the backbone of modern humanoid robotics.

module-1/chapter-2-rclpy-control.title: Chapter 2: Controlling Robots with rclpy
module-1/chapter-2-rclpy-control.description: rclpy is the official Python client library for ROS 2. It allows you to write ROS 2 nodes in Python and interact with the entire ROS 2 graph.

module-1/chapter-3-urdf-fundamentals.title: Chapter 3: URDF Fundamentals
module-1/chapter-3-urdf-fundamentals.description: The Unified Robot Description Format (URDF) is an XML format used in ROS to describe all elements of a robot model. This includes the robot's links, joints, sensors, and their physical properties.

module-1/chapter-4-joint-control-project.title: Chapter 4: Project - Simple Humanoid Joint Control
module-1/chapter-4-joint-control-project.description: This project brings together all the concepts from the previous chapters to create a functional joint control pipeline for our humanoid robot.

module-2/chapter-1-gazebo-physics.title: Chapter 1: Gazebo Physics
module-2/chapter-1-gazebo-physics.description: Gazebo is the classic simulator for ROS. It provides a robust physics engine and a rich set of plugins to simulate everything from simple sensors to complex humanoid dynamics.

module-2/chapter-2-unity-digital-twin.title: Chapter 2: Building a Unity Digital Twin
module-2/chapter-2-unity-digital-twin.description: While Gazebo is great for physics, Unity is the industry standard for high-fidelity visualization and human-robot interaction (HRI). A digital twin in Unity allows for realistic rendering and interactive experiences.

module-2/chapter-3-sensor-simulation.title: Chapter 3: Sensor Simulation in Gazebo & Unity
module-2/chapter-3-sensor-simulation.description: Sensors are the eyes and ears of a robot. Both Gazebo and Unity provide mechanisms to simulate realistic sensor data and stream it into ROS 2.

module-3-isaac/chapter-1-isaac-sim-funda.title: Chapter 1: Isaac Sim Fundamentals
module-3-isaac/chapter-1-isaac-sim-funda.description: NVIDIA Isaac Sim is a powerful robotics simulation platform built on NVIDIA Omniverse. It provides a photorealistic environment and highly accurate physics for developing and testing robots.

module-3-isaac/chapter-2-isaac-ros-vslam.title: Chapter 2: Isaac ROS VSLAM + Perception
module-3-isaac/chapter-2-isaac-ros-vslam.description: NVIDIA Isaac ROS is a collection of hardware-accelerated packages that allow ROS 2 developers to leverage the full power of NVIDIA GPUs for perception and navigation.

module-3-isaac/chapter-3-nav2-humanoid-p.title: Chapter 3: Nav2 Path Planning for Humanoids
module-3-isaac/chapter-3-nav2-humanoid-p.description: Autonomous navigation is a core requirement for humanoid robots. While traditional robots use wheels, humanoids require a more complex approach to planning that accounts for stability and stepping.

module-3-isaac/chapter-4-isaac-sim-ros-w.title: Chapter 4: Isaac Sim â†’ Isaac ROS Workflow
module-3-isaac/chapter-4-isaac-sim-ros-w.description: The true power of this stack lies in the seamless transition from simulation to real-world algorithms. This chapter explores the "Sim-to-Algorithm" pipeline.

module-4-vla/chapter-1-voice-to-action.title: Chapter 1: Voice-to-Action
module-4-vla/chapter-1-voice-to-action.description: This chapter explores the fundamental concepts behind converting a spoken command into a robotic action. This voice-to-action pipeline is a cornerstone of modern human-robot interaction (HRI).

module-4-vla/chapter-2-cognitive-plannin.title: Chapter 2: Cognitive Planning with LLMs
module-4-vla/chapter-2-cognitive-plannin.description: Cognitive planning is the "brain" of an autonomous robot. It involves taking a high-level, often abstract, goal and breaking it down into a concrete sequence of actions.

module-4-vla/chapter-3-capstone-overview.title: Chapter 3: Capstone - The VLA Workflow
module-4-vla/chapter-3-capstone-overview.description: This chapter illustrates the full end-to-end system, where perception, reasoning, and action come together.
